Class MyFriend

  • java.lang.Object
    • MyFriend

  • public class MyFriend
extends java.lang.Object
    Little friends that play with you and with each other!

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int MAX_FOOD
      The max food level.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyFriend()
      creates a MyFriend with name "Generic Friend" and hunger of MAX_FOOD.
      MyFriend(java.lang.String name)
      creates a MyFriend with name name and hunger of MAX_FOOD.
      MyFriend(java.lang.String name, int food)
      creates a MyFriend with name name and hunger of food.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_FOOD

        public final int MAX_FOOD
        The max food level. 3 by default.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyFriend

        public MyFriend()
        creates a MyFriend with name "Generic Friend" and hunger of MAX_FOOD.

      • MyFriend

        public MyFriend(java.lang.String name)
        creates a MyFriend with name name and hunger of MAX_FOOD.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this friend.

      • MyFriend

        public MyFriend(java.lang.String name,
        int food)
        creates a MyFriend with name name and hunger of food.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this friend
        food - the starting food level of this MyFriend.

    • Method Detail

      • eat

        public boolean eat()
        Has this friend eat to raise hunger by 1. Doesn't eat if full.
        Returns:
        if the friend ate or not.

      • eat

        public boolean eat(int eat)
        Has this friend eat to raise hunger by a param. Eats until done or full.
        Parameters:
        eat - the amount of food to eat.
        Returns:
        if the friend ate anything or not.

      • play

        public boolean play()
        Has this friend play, reducing its food level. prints out name + " played for a while" and returns true if hunger is greater than 0. Then reduces hunger by 1. Prints name + " is too hungry to play." and returns false otherwise.
        Returns:
        if this friend played.

      • playWith

        public boolean playWith(MyFriend friend)
        has this friend play with another, reducing the food level of both. Prints out "name1 and name2 played with each other!" and returns true if both hungers are at least 2, then reduces both hungers by 2. Prints out "name is too hungry to play" otherwise.
        Returns:
        weather both friends were able to play.

      • reduceFood

        public int reduceFood(int hunger)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        reduces the hunger of this MyFriend.
        Parameters:
        hunger - the amount to lower the hunger by.
        Returns:
        the food level at the end of invocation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the hunger was greater than the food level.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        returns the name of this friend.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the name of this friend.

      • getFood

        public int getFood()
        returns the food level of this friend.
        Returns:
        The food level of this friend.
